newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: INSIGHT - DUTCH CHARTISTS DIVIDED ON AEX TREND.
newsitem.headline: INSIGHT - DUTCH CHARTISTS DIVIDED ON AEX TREND.

text.p: Dutch chartists said on Monday
they remained divided between a neutral and slightly upbeat
stance on the AEX stock market index in the coming week.
"We stick to our neutral stance," said ING Barings, adding a
break below 737 points would further delay any positive scope.
The index slipped to a low of 733.02 points in Monday
morning trade, but recovered to almost 737 points by late
afternoon.
It rose 8.54 points to close at 737.46 points on Friday,
after briefly touching a new all-time high of 755.73 points on
Wednesday.
Contributor Trend Pvs view Support Resistance
First Second First Second
ING Barings Sideways Sideways 737 715 742 755
ABN AMRO Neutral Neutral 730 722 742 755
JAAD UP Up 644 636 --- ---
Rabo Sec. UP Up 724 703 --- ---
Meespierson NEUTRAL Neutral 715 --- 740 ---
Note - Contributors' own analysis follows.
ING Barings - The AEX, falling below its support level at
742.50 shows slowly weakening technicals. As the AEX is forming
a trading range within the boundaries of its rising trend
channel, we stick to our neutral stance. A break below 737.00
points would further delay a positive scope. Then look for a
knee-jerk towards the lower side of teh rising trend channel at
715-720. A break above 742 is required to have the uptrend
resumed. The technical indicators of the AEX confirm a neutral
short term outlook. Momentum is petering out, indicating that
the bull train is running out of steam.
Money flow indicators of the Amsterdam stock market are
levelling off, suggesting that buyers are becoming less
aggressive. The advantage/decline ratio (in measurement of
market breadth) is forming a minor top, suggesting that market
is lacking leadership.
RABO SECURITIES - AEX weakened by the price action of last
Friday and fell back in its former rising trend channel. We
expect it to test the lower boundary of its rising trend channel
and bounce back. This resistance is at approximately 724. This
correction can be used to expand long positions. Long term trend
intact and we expect to end week at approximately same level.
MEESPIERSON - Due to worsening short term indicators we stay
neutral for this week. The AEX is expected to stay in the
period of consolidation which formed from last week on.
ABN AMRO - Last week's correction in the AEX has brought us
to lower price levels without harming any upward potential. This
move was just a search for support in a nervous market. At the
moment, we see the index bottoming out above 730, after which we
expect the AEX to place a renewed attack on 740 in the first
place after which the previous top comes in sight. Subsequently,
our short-term indicators are starting to turn upward again.
This implies that the correction is passing.
However, we need more confirmation before we advice to
re-enter long positions. This confirmation is found when we see
prices that reach above the 742 level.
There we see the end of the short term down move which was
initiated at the top last week.
Therefore, we state that staying neutral is the best way to
cope with present situation on the AEX. However, when we take a
look at the underlying stocks that form the AEX, we can conclude
that there is no real danger of lower prices. This view is
confirmed when compared to related markets like the major stock
markets, the bund future and dollar/mark.
